"There are things you can do to try and delay the progressionof kidney disease. Keeping your blood pressure under controlis key; especially by using an ACE-inhibitor type of blood pressuremedicine with “pril” as the suffix. Know your lab test resultsand try to keep your hemoglobin A1C under 7.0%, yourblood pressure under 130/80, your bad cholesterol less than100, and eat no more than 0.08 gms/kg body weight of anytype of protein per day. A proper diet is another way to slowthe progression of diabetes and kidney disease.
